intro: Axinaea bracteata, commonly known as the velvet tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a leathery texture, while its fruits are small, round berries that contain several seeds. Axinaea bracteata is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
